key.name: migrate-prefs-done
key.description: This setting is obsolete and will be removed in the next major gnucash release series.

key.name: prefs-version
key.description: This is used internally to determine whether some preferences may need conversion when switching to a newer version of GnuCash.

key.name: save-window-geometry
key.description: If active, the size and location of each dialog window will be saved when it is closed. The sizes and locations of content windows will be remembered when you quit GnuCash. Otherwise the sizes will not be saved.

key.name: account-separator
key.summary: Character to use as separator between account names
key.description: This setting determines the character that will be used between components of an account name. Possible values are any single non-alphanumeric unicode character, or any of the following strings: "colon", "slash", "backslash", "dash" and "period".

key.name: assoc-head
key.description: This is the path head for the Transaction Linked Files with relative paths

key.name: file-compression
key.description: Enables file compression when writing the data file.

key.name: autosave-show-explanation
key.description: If active, GnuCash shows an explanation of the auto-save feature the first time that feature is started. Otherwise no extra explanation is shown.

key.name: autosave-interval-minutes
key.description: The number of minutes until saving of the data file to harddisk will be started automatically. If zero, no saving will be started automatically.

key.name: save-on-close-expires
key.summary: Enable timeout on "Save changes on closing" question
key.description: If enabled, the "Save changes on closing" question will only wait a limited number of seconds for an answer. If the user didn't answer within that time, the changes will be saved automatically and the question window closed.

key.name: save-on-close-wait-time
key.description: The number of seconds to wait before the question window will be closed and the changes saved automatically.

key.name: negative-in-red
key.description: Display negative amounts in red

key.name: auto-decimal-point
key.description: If active, GnuCash will automatically insert a decimal point into values that are entered without one. Otherwise GnuCash will not modify entered numbers.

key.name: auto-decimal-places
key.description: This field specifies the number of automatic decimal places that will be filled in.

key.name: force-price-decimal
key.summary: Force prices to display as decimals even if they must be rounded.
key.description: If active, GnuCash will round prices as necessary to display them as decimals instead of displaying the exact fraction if the fractional part cannot be exactly represented as a decimal.

key.name: retain-type-never
key.description: This setting specifies what to do with old log/backups files. "forever" means keep all old files. "never" means no old log/backup files are kept. Each time you save, older versions of the file are removed. "days" means keep old files for a number of days. How many days is defined in key 'retain-days'

key.name: retain-type-days
key.summary: Delete old log/backup files after this many days (0 = never).
key.description: This setting specifies what to do with old log/backups files. "forever" means keep all old files. "never" means no old log/backup files are kept. Each time you save, older versions of the file are removed. "days" means keep old files for a number of days. How many days is defined in key 'retain-days'

key.name: retain-type-forever
key.description: This setting specifies what to do with old log/backups files. "forever" means keep all old files. "never" means no old log/backup files are kept. Each time you save, older versions of the file are removed. "days" means keep old files for a number of days. How many days is defined in key 'retain-days'

key.name: retain-days
key.summary: Delete old log/backup files after this many days (0 = never)
key.description: This setting specifies the number of days after which old log/backup files will be deleted (0 = never).

key.name: reversed-accounts-none
key.description: This setting allows certain accounts to have their balances reversed in sign from positive to negative, or vice versa. The setting "income-expense" is for users who like to see negative expenses and positive income. The setting of "credit" is for users who want to see balances reflect the debit/credit status of the account. The setting "none" doesn't reverse the sign on any balances.

key.name: reversed-accounts-credit
key.summary: Sign reverse balances on the following: Credit Card, Payable, Liability, Equity, and Income.
key.description: This setting allows certain accounts to have their balances reversed in sign from positive to negative, or vice versa. The setting "income-expense" is for users who like to see negative expenses and positive income. The setting of "credit" is for users who want to see balances reflect the debit/credit status of the account. The setting "none" doesn't reverse the sign on any balances.

key.name: reversed-accounts-incomeexpense
key.summary: Sign reverse balances on income and expense accounts.
key.description: This setting allows certain accounts to have their balances reversed in sign from positive to negative, or vice versa. The setting "income-expense" is for users who like to see negative expenses and positive income. The setting of "credit" is for users who want to see balances reflect the debit/credit status of the account. The setting "none" doesn't reverse the sign on any balances.

key.name: show-account-color
key.summary: Use account colors in the account hierarchy
key.description: If active the account hierarchy will colorize the account using the account's custom color if set. This can serve as a visual aid to quickly identify accounts.

key.name: show-account-color-tabs
key.summary: Use account colors in the tabs of open account registers
key.description: If active the account register tabs will be colored using the account's custom color if set. This can serve as a visual aid to quickly identify accounts.

key.name: use-accounting-labels
key.description: If active, formal accounting labels "Credit" and "Debit" will be used when designating fields on screen. Otherwise, informal labels such as Increase/Decrease, "Funds In"/"Funds Out", etc. will be used.

key.name: tab-close-buttons
key.summary: Show close buttons on notebook tabs
key.description: If active, a "close" button will be displayed on any notebook tab that may be closed. Otherwise, no such button will be shown on the tab. Regardless of this setting, pages can always be closed via the "close" menu item or the "close" button on toolbar.

key.name: tab-width
key.description: This key specifies the maximum width of notebook tabs. If the text in the tab is longer than this value (the test is approximate) then the tab label will have the middle cut and replaced with an ellipsis.

key.name: tab-open-adjacent
key.summary: Opens new tab adjacent to current tab instead of at the end
key.description: If active, new tabs are opened adjacent to current tab. If inactive, the new tabs are opened instead at the end.

key.name: currency-choice-locale
key.summary: Use the system locale currency for all newly created accounts.
key.description: This setting controls the source of the default currency for new accounts. If set to "locale" then GnuCash will retrieve the default currency from the user's locale setting. If set to "other", GnuCash will use the setting specified by the currency-other key.

key.name: currency-choice-other
key.summary: Use the specified currency for all newly created accounts.
key.description: This setting controls the source of the default currency for new accounts. If set to "locale" then GnuCash will retrieve the default currency from the user's locale setting. If set to "other", GnuCash will use the setting specified by the currency-other key.

key.name: currency-other
key.description: This setting specifies the default currency used for new accounts if the currency-choice setting is set to "other". This field must contain the three letter ISO 4217 code for a currency (e.g. USD, GBP, RUB).

key.name: clock-24h
key.description: If active, use a 24 hour time format. Otherwise use a 12 hour time format.

key.name: date-format
key.description: This setting chooses the way dates are displayed in GnuCash. Possible values for this setting are "locale" to use the system locale setting, "ce" for Continental Europe style dates, "iso" for ISO 8601 standard dates , "uk" for United Kingdom style dates, and "us" for United States style dates.

key.name: date-completion-thisyear
key.description: When a date is entered without year it can be completed so that it will be within the current calendar year or close to the current date based on a sliding window starting a set number of months backwards in time.

key.name: date-completion-sliding
key.summary: In a sliding 12-month window starting a configurable number of months before the current month
key.description: When a date is entered without year it can be completed so that it will be within the current calendar year or close to the current date based on a sliding window starting a set number of months backwards in time.

key.name: date-backmonths
key.summary: Maximum number of months to go back.
key.description: Dates will be completed so that they are close to the current date. Enter the maximum number of months to go backwards in time when completing dates.

key.name: grid-lines-horizontal
key.description: If active, horizontal grid lines will be shown on table displays. Otherwise no horizontal grid lines will be shown.

key.name: grid-lines-vertical
key.description: If active, vertical grid lines will be shown on table displays. Otherwise no vertical grid lines will be shown.

key.name: show-splash-screen
key.description: If active, a splash screen will be shown at startup. Otherwise no splash screen will be shown.

key.name: tab-position-top
key.summary: Display the notebook tabs at the top of the window.
key.description: This setting determines the edge at which the tabs for switching pages in notebooks are drawn. Possible values are "top", "left", "bottom" and "right". It defaults to "top".

key.name: tab-position-bottom
key.summary: Display the notebook tabs at the bottom of the window.
key.description: This setting determines the edge at which the tabs for switching pages in notebooks are drawn. Possible values are "top", "left", "bottom" and "right". It defaults to "top".

key.name: tab-position-left
key.summary: Display the notebook tabs at the left of the window.
key.description: This setting determines the edge at which the tabs for switching pages in notebooks are drawn. Possible values are "top", "left", "bottom" and "right". It defaults to "top".

key.name: tab-position-right
key.summary: Display the notebook tabs at the right of the window.
key.description: This setting determines the edge at which the tabs for switching pages in notebooks are drawn. Possible values are "top", "left", "bottom" and "right". It defaults to "top".

key.name: summarybar-position-top
key.summary: Display the summary bar at the top of the page.
key.description: This setting determines the edge at which the summary bar for various pages is drawn. Possible values are "top" and "bottom". It defaults to "bottom".

key.name: summarybar-position-bottom
key.summary: Display the summary bar at the bottom of the page.
key.description: This setting determines the edge at which the summary bar for various pages is drawn. Possible values are "top" and "bottom". It defaults to "bottom".

key.name: tab-next-recent
key.summary: Closing a tab moves to the most recently visited tab.
key.description: If active, closing a tab moves to the most recently visited tab. Otherwise closing a tab moves one tab to the left.

key.name: num-source
key.summary: Set book option on new files to use split "action" field for "Num" field on registers/reports
key.description: If selected, the default book option for new files is set so that the 'Num' cell on registers shows/updates the split 'action' field and the transaction 'num' field is shown on the second line in double line mode (and is not visible in single line mode). Otherwise, the default book option for new files is set so that the 'Num' cell on registers shows/updates the transaction 'num' field.

key.name: use-gnucash-color-theme
key.summary: Color the register using a gnucash specific color theme
key.description: When enabled the register will use a GnuCash specific color theme (green/yellow). Otherwise it will use the system color theme. Regardless of this setting the user can always override the color theme via a gnucash specific css file to be stored in the gnucash used config directory. More information can be found in the gnucash FAQ.

key.name: use-theme-colors
key.description: This option is temporarily kept around for backwards compatibility. It will be removed in a future version.

key.name: enter-moves-to-end
key.summary: "Enter" key moves to bottom of register
key.description: If active, pressing the enter key will move to the bottom of the register. Otherwise pressing the enter key will move to the next transaction line.

key.name: auto-raise-lists
key.summary: Automatically raise the list of accounts or actions during input
key.description: Automatically raise the list of accounts or actions during input

key.name: tab-to-transfer-on-memorised
key.summary: Move to Transfer field when memorised transaction auto filled
key.description: If active then after a memorised transaction is automatically filled in the cursor will move to the Transfer field. If not active then it skips to the value field.

key.name: use-new-window
key.summary: Create a new window for each new register
key.description: If active, each new register will be opened in a new window. Otherwise each new register will be opened as a tab in the main window.

key.name: alternate-color-by-transaction
key.summary: Color all lines of a transaction the same
key.description: If active all lines that make up a single transaction will use the same color for their background. Otherwise the background colors are alternated on each line.

key.name: draw-horizontal-lines
key.summary: Show horizontal borders in a register
key.description: Show horizontal borders between rows in a register. If active the border between cells will be indicated with a heavy line. Otherwise the border between cells will not be marked.

key.name: draw-vertical-lines
key.summary: Show vertical borders in a register
key.description: Show vertical borders between columns in a register. If active the border between cells will be indicated with a heavy line. Otherwise the border between cells will not be marked.

key.name: future-after-blank-transaction
key.summary: Show future transactions after the blank transaction in a register
key.description: Show future transactions after the blank transaction in a register. If active then transactions with a date in the future will be displayed at the bottom of the register after the blank transaction. Otherwise the blank transaction will be at the bottom of the register after all transactions.

key.name: default-style-ledger
key.summary: Show all transactions on one line or in double line mode on two.
key.description: This field specifies the default view style when opening a new register window. Possible values are "ledger", "auto-ledger" and "journal". The "ledger" setting says to show each transaction on one or two lines. The "auto-ledger" setting does the same, but also expands only the current transaction to show all splits. The "journal" setting shows all transactions in expanded form.

key.name: default-style-autoledger
key.summary: Automatically expand the current transaction to show all splits. All other transactions are shown on one line or in double line mode on two.
key.description: This field specifies the default view style when opening a new register window. Possible values are "ledger", "auto-ledger" and "journal". The "ledger" setting says to show each transaction on one or two lines. The "auto-ledger" setting does the same, but also expands only the current transaction to show all splits. The "journal" setting shows all transactions in expanded form.

key.name: default-style-journal
key.summary: All transactions are expanded to show all splits.
key.description: This field specifies the default view style when opening a new register window. Possible values are "ledger", "auto-ledger" and "journal". The "ledger" setting says to show each transaction on one or two lines. The "auto-ledger" setting does the same, but also expands only the current transaction to show all splits. The "journal" setting shows all transactions in expanded form.

key.name: double-line-mode
key.summary: Show a second line with "Action", "Notes", and "Linked Documents" for each transaction.
key.description: Show a second line with "Action", "Notes", and "Linked Documents" for each transaction in a register. This is the default setting for when a register is first opened. The setting can be changed at any time via the "View->Double Line" menu item.

key.name: show-leaf-account-names
key.description: Show only the names of the leaf accounts in the register and in the account selection popup. The default behaviour is to display the full name, including the path in the account tree. Activating this option implies that you use unique leaf names.

key.name: show-extra-dates
key.summary: Show the entered and reconcile dates
key.description: Show the date when the transaction was entered below the posted date and reconciled date on split row.

key.name: show-extra-dates-on-selection
key.summary: Show entered and reconciled dates on selection
key.description: Show the entered date and reconciled date on transaction selection.

key.name: show-calendar-buttons
key.description: Show the calendar buttons Cancel, Today and Select.

key.name: selection-to-blank-on-expand
key.summary: Move the selection to the blank split on expand
key.description: This will move the selection to the blank split when the transaction is expanded.

key.name: max-transactions
key.summary: Number of transactions to show in a register.
key.description: Show this many transactions in a register. A value of zero means show all transactions.

key.name: key-length
key.summary: Number of characters for auto complete.
key.description: This sets the number of characters before auto complete starts for description, notes and memo fields.

key.name: use-new-window
key.summary: Create a new window for each new report
key.description: If active, each new report will be opened in its own window. Otherwise new reports will be opened as tabs in the main window.

key.name: currency-choice-locale
key.summary: Use the system locale currency for all newly created reports.
key.description: This setting controls the default currency used for reports. If set to "locale" then GnuCash will retrieve the default currency from the user's locale setting. If set to "other", GnuCash will use the setting specified by the currency-other key.

key.name: currency-choice-other
key.summary: Use the specified currency for all newly created reports.
key.description: This setting controls the source of the default currency for new accounts. If set to "locale" then GnuCash will retrieve the default currency from the user's locale setting. If set to "other", GnuCash will use the setting specified by the currency-other key.

key.name: currency-other
key.description: This setting controls the default currency used for reports. If set to "locale" then GnuCash will retrieve the default currency from the user's locale setting. If set to "other", GnuCash will use the setting specified by the currency-other key.

key.name: default-zoom
key.summary: Zoom factor to use by default for reports.
key.description: On high resolution screens reports tend to be hard to read. This option allows you to scale reports up by the set factor. For example setting this to 2.0 will display reports at twice their typical size.

key.name: filename-format
key.description: This setting chooses the file name for PDF export. This is a sprintf(3) string with three arguments: "%1$s" is the report name such as "Invoice". "%2$s" is the number of the report, which for an invoice report is the invoice number. "%3$s" is the date of the report, formatted according to the filename-date-format setting. Note: Any characters that are not allowed in filenames, such as '/', will be replaced with underscores '_' in the resulting file name.

key.name: filename-date-format
key.summary: PDF export file name date format choice
key.description: This setting chooses the way dates are used in the filename of PDF export. Possible values for this setting are "locale" to use the system locale setting, "ce" for Continental Europe style dates, "iso" for ISO 8601 standard dates , "uk" for United Kingdom style dates, and "us" for United States style dates.

key.name: allow-file-incompatibility
key.summary: Allow file incompatibility with older versions.
key.description: If active, gnucash will be allowed to intentionally break file compatibility with older versions, so that a data file saved in this version cannot be read by an older version again. Otherwise gnucash will write data files only in formats that can be read by older versions as well.

key.summary: Is tax included in this type of business entry?
key.description: If set to active then tax is included by default in entries of this type. This setting is inherited by new customers and vendors.

key.name: auto-pay
key.description: At post time, automatically attempt to pay customer documents with outstanding pre-payments and counter documents. The pre-payments and documents obviously have to be against the same customer. Counter documents are documents with opposite sign. For example for an invoice, customer credit notes and negative invoices are considered counter documents.

key.name: notify-when-due
key.summary: Show invoices due reminder at startup
key.description: If active, at startup GnuCash will check to see whether any invoices will become due soon. If so, it will present the user with a reminder dialog. The definition of "soon" is controlled by the "Days in Advance" setting. Otherwise GnuCash does not check for due invoices.

key.name: days-in-advance
key.summary: Show invoices due within this many days
key.description: This field defines the number of days in advance that GnuCash will check for due invoices. Its value is only used if the "Notify when due" setting is active.

key.name: enable-toolbuttons
key.summary: Enable extra toolbar buttons for business
key.description: If active, extra toolbar buttons for common business functions are shown as well. Otherwise they are not shown.

key.name: invoice-printreport

key.description: The name of the report to be used for invoice printing.

key.name: use-new-window
key.summary: Open new invoice in new window
key.description: If active, each new invoice will be opened in a new window. Otherwise a new invoice will be opened as a tab in the main window.

key.name: accumulate-splits
key.description: If this field is active then multiple entries in an invoice that transfer to the same account will be accumulated into a single split. This field can be overridden per invoice in the Posting dialog.

key.name: tax-included
key.summary: Is tax included in this type of business entry?
key.description: If set to active then tax is included by default in entries of this type. This setting is inherited by new customers and vendors.

key.description: This field specifies the extra fee that is taken into account when matching imported transactions. In some places commercial ATMs (not belonging to a financial institution) are installed in places like convenience stores. These ATMs add their fee directly to the amount instead of showing up as a separate transaction or in your monthly banking fees. For example, you withdraw $100, and you are charged $101,50 plus Interac fees. If you manually entered that $100, the amounts won't match. You should set this to whatever is the maximum such fee in your area (in units of your local currency), so the transaction will be recognised as a match.
